text: pumpkin spice matcha latte today I'm
combining one of my favorite ingredients
matcha with real pumpkin to make a
healthy homemade version of Starbucks
pumpkin spice lattes now feel free to
change up the ingredients to however you
like it but this is how I like to make
mine first start with some pumpkin puree
you can buy a can then store the rest in
a mason jar for when you want to make
more lattes later take one and a half
tablespoons of pumpkin and add that to a
small saucepan then add half a teaspoon
of your favorite pumpkin pie spice which
is just a blend of cinnamon ginger
nutmeg and allspice add to that half a
teaspoon of vanilla extract and make
your way over to the stove we'll want to
heat these ingredients over low heat to
bring out the flavors of the pumpkin and
spices also make sure to stir constantly
so it doesn't burn
next take one and a half teaspoons of
matcha powder and about two tablespoons
of water and whisk everything together
to make a paste now it's time to add
your choice of milk and today I'm using
unsweetened soy milk but regular dairy
milk will work just as well mix and
whisk until everything is combined
and finally sweeten the drink with a bit
of organic cane sugar
once it's done pour the drink into a
large serving mug and optional if you're
feeling like a splurge add a generous
amount of whipped cream sprinkled with
cinnamon
so that's how fun and easy it is to make
a movie versions of pumpkin spice matcha
latte they're so good
so comforting it's the perfect fall
drink yeah not to mention we'll save
yourself a lot of money by making these
at home I'm Angela
I hope you enjoyed this video give me a
thumbs up if you did and don't forget to
subscribe to my channel because I have
more matcha inspired recipes coming very
soon I'll see you guys next time bye
